pr_title: Fix clear year and month field when converting to biblatex

timeline.message: ISSUE :: 6224 - allow merging of year and date if identical
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:JabRef/jabref into fix-for-issue-6224
Updated Changelog.md file with fixed issue

timeline.bodyText: I think there should also be a check that the information in the date field coincides with the one in year & month. For example, if date = {2004-05} but year = {2005} the year field shouldn't be deleted.
timeline.author: tobiasdiez

replies.bodyText: Is this really the job of this class? The code assures, that there is something in the date field. I don't think that the cleanup class has to check, if the conversion was done right...
replies.author: calixtus

replies.bodyText:
I agree with @tobiasdiez we should check if the date is equal to the year.
If it is a user error, there is no point in removing it and it is always an alert that made a mistake.
replies.author: catarinagomespt

timeline.message: Check If date field is filled and is equal to year it should be removed the year and month fields
Added unit test: Cleanup With Date Already Present And Equals To Year Removes Year And Month
ISSUE :: 6224 - Separated org.jabref.model.FieldChange from previous imports
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:JabRef/jabref into fix-for-issue-6224

timeline.bodyText: Can you give the variable year1 a more meaningful name? Sure, everybody understands that, but nevertheless, we try to write exemplary code in JabRef (I know, it's still a loooooong way to go).
timeline.author: calixtus

replies.bodyText: you're right, I forgot to change
replies.author: catarinagomespt

timeline.message: Merge branch 'master' of github.com:JabRef/jabref into fix-for-issue-6224

timeline.bodyText: This should be 2011-01 to include the month, right?
timeline.author: tobiasdiez

timeline.bodyText: Adding to @koppor's comment, we have a date class which you can use to parse the date in order to get the year AND the month.
timeline.author: tobiasdiez

replies.bodyText:
@koppor @tobiasdiez
Please confirm that I understood correctly:
Acceptance Criteria  1:

If the month + year fields are equal to the month + year in the date field, must clear the month and the year.
Start:
date = "2020-05"
month = "05"
year = "2020"
Result:
date = "2020-05"
month = ""
year = ""

Acceptance Criteria 2:

If the month field is different from the month in the date field, does nothing
Start:
date = "2020-05"
month = "04"
year = "2020"
Result:
date = "2020-05"
month = "04"
year = "2020"

Acceptance Criteria 3:

If the year field is different from the year in the date field, does nothing
Start:
date = "2020-05"
month = "05"
year = "2019"
Result:
date = "2020-05"
month = "05"
year = "2019"

Acceptance Criteria 4:

If the date field has a blank/empty value, must set the date field with year and month values and clear the month + year fields.
Start:
date = ""
month = "05"
year = "2020"
Result:
date = "2020-05"
month = ""
year = ""

Thanks
replies.author: catarinagomespt

replies.bodyText:
@koppor @tobiasdiez
Another question:
What should happen if we have the following situation?
date = "2020"
month = "04"
year = "2020"
Result: ???
replies.author: catarinagomespt

replies.bodyText: I think in scenario 2 + 3 the correct information (the month in 2, the year in 3) can be deleted leaving only differing information behind. Thanks for the detailed specification.
replies.author: tobiasdiez

replies.bodyText:
@tobiasdiez
Just to make sure I got it right.
Start:
date = "2020-05"
month = "04"
year = "2020"
Result:
date = "2020-05"
month = "04"
year = ""
Please, confirms that the result is correct.
replies.author: catarinagomespt

replies.bodyText: For inconsistent data: Don't overwrite/move. Keep as is
replies.author: Siedlerchr
catarinagomespt

ISSUE :: 6224 - For inconsistent data: Do not overwrite/move
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:JabRef/jabref into fix-for-issue-6224

timeline.bodyText: Could you please adjust the javadoc as well?
timeline.author: Siedlerchr

timeline.bodyText:
One of the Date.parse method overloads accepts already Optional as parameter, so you can make your code a bit easier and remove the ifPressent checks for Year and month
so you would have checkDate = Date.parse(entry.getFieldOrAlias(StandardField.YEAR),  entry.getFieldOrAlias(StandardField.Month), Optional.empty())
timeline.author: Siedlerchr

replies.bodyText: @Siedlerchr Thanks for the tip. Already did that.
replies.author: catarinagomespt

timeline.bodyText:
Just a quick note,
The Optional equals also returns true if both are empty.
That could be the case when there is a value in all fields, but it's invalid., eg maybe some random letters.
Could you please add a test case for that as well. Then you should have all cases covered. I think in practice this doesn't matter but code wise it would be nice to have this edge case covered as well.
Otherwise it's looking good to me! Thanks again for your ongoing contribution
https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/util/Optional.html#equals-java.lang.Object-
timeline.author: Siedlerchr

replies.bodyText: @Siedlerchr You are right, if both fields are empty returns true. I added a new test case to cover it.
replies.author: catarinagomespt

timeline.message: Merge branch 'master' of github.com:JabRef/jabref into fix-for-issue-6224
